original: GEIJER, Per Adolf, Professor, överdirektör, Djursholm, f Sthlm 7/5 86 av gen.major S G A G o Ketty Glosemeyer, gm Ester Hagström. Mog.ex Sthlm 04, Upps univ o StHS, fil kand 08, aman v mineralog.geolog inst Upps 07—08, fil lic o fil dr 10, prof:s namn 27. Doc i Petrografi o malmgeologi StHS 10 —25, uppeh tidvis professur, vik statsgeolog 14—16, ord d:o 16—31, förordn att uppeh ch.-befattn v Sv Geol Undersökn 29, överdir o ch där sed. 42, prof i mineralogi o geologi KTH 31-41, prorektor där 40—41. Stdsflm i Djursh 31—34, styr.led i Djursh samsk fr 28 o ordf där fr 34. Styr.led i Geol Frn i Sthlm 14— 20, 31—35 o 39, ordf där 20, 34 o 39, v. presid i Soc of Economic Geologists 34, i Geologische Vereinigung 35, korresp led Geol Soc America 39, led Sv Tekn.frn o ordf i dess avd f tekn undervisn 40—42. Resor: Utom Europa av USA o Canada 13, Nordafr 26, Chile mfl länder 28. Av trycket: Igneous rocks and iron öres of Kiirunavaara, Luossavaara and Tuol-luvaara (grad.avh 10) smt ett flert skrifter, huvudsakl rör malmgeologi, Petrografi o mineralogi, i Sv Geol Undersökn :s publ, Geol Frns i Sthlm förhandl, Economic Geology mfl publ.serier, medarb i Uppfinn :s Bok o De Tekn Vetenskaperna. RNO, RVO, RNS:tOO-Ikl; L VA, LIVA.GEIJER, Karl Herman Thorild, Direktör, Karlstad, f Krist 22/5 03 av konsul H V G o Julie af Ekström, gm Ebba Wallberg. Realex, Gbgs hdlsinst. Anst Carl J Svensson, Wupperfeld, Tyskl, 22—23, AB Vacuum Oil Co Sthlm 30—32, Herman Geijer & Co AB Krist 24—30 o sed. 32. Styr.suppl Werml En-gross.frn, styr.led Sv Wallboardgross.frn. Resor: Tyskl, Polen, Ung, Frankr, Engl 23—39. Hobby: Frimärken. von GEIJER, Gottschalk Knut Bror Fredrik, Civilingenjör, Västerås, f Allerum, Malmöh l, 22/8 00 av borgmäst K E von G o Esther Henckel, gm Karin Tamm. Studex Sthlm 20, KTH (E) 22—26. Anst v Telegrafvkt 27, Pat-o Registr.vkt 27—29, Stat Vattenf.vk Älvkarleby kraftvk Sthlm 29, nu distr.ing f samma kraftvk i Västerås. Led Sv Tekn.frn. °af GEIJERSTAM, Erik Olof Emanuel, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Rockhammar, Fellingsbro, öbr l, 29/5 05 av bruksäg C af G o Eivor Stanzén, gm Brita Sundin. Studex öbr 23, KTH (E) 25—29. Resoffex 25, fänr Uppl art.-reg:s res 25, ulöjtn Norrl art.regis res 28, löjtn 30. Anst v AB Max Sievert 33—34, Centrala Flygverkst Västerås 35—36, AB Sv Fläktfabr Sthlm sed. 36. Led Sv Tekn.frn. °af GEIJERSTAM, Olof Erik Wilhelm Emanuel, Civilingenjör, Hasslarp, f Malmö 30/6 11 av civ.ing T E af G o Eva Lindencrona. Studex Kkrona 29, KTH (kemi) 29—33. Kem v Sv Sockerfabr AB:s sockerfabr Örtofta 34— 36, sockerfabr Staffanstorp 36, nu driftsing v Hasslarps sockerbruk. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated:
GEIJER, Per Adolf, Professor, Senior Director, Djursholm, b. Stockholm 7/5 1886, son of Major General S.G.A.G and Ketty Glosemeyer, m. Ester Hagström. M.A. Stockholm 1904, Uppsala University and StHS, Bachelor of Arts 1908, Teaching Assistant at the Mineralogy-Geology Institute in Uppsala 1907-1908, Licentiate and Doctor of Philosophy 1910, appointed Professor in 1927. Docent in Petrography and Ore Geology at StHS 1910-1925, occasionally held professorship, acting state geologist 1914-1916, appointed state geologist 1916-1931, appointed to hold the position of Chief Superintendent of the Swedish Geological Survey in 1929, Senior Director and Chief Superintendent from 1942, professor of Mineralogy and Geology at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1931-1941, Vice Rector there 1940-1941. Member of the Stockholm City Council in Djursholm 1931-1934, Board Member of Djursholm Co-educational School from 1928 and Chairman from 1934. Board Member of the Geological Society of Stockholm 1914-1920, 1931-1935, and 1939, Chairman in 1920, 1934, and 1939, Vice President of the Society of Economic Geologists 1934, President of the Geologische Vereinigung 1935, Corresponding Member of the Geological Society of America 1939, Member of the Swedish Engineering Association and Chairman of its Technical Education Department 1940-1942. Travels: Outside Europe to the USA and Canada in 1913, North Africa in 1926, Chile and other countries in 1928. Publications include "Igneous rocks and iron ores of Kiirunavaara, Luossavaara, and Tuollavaara" (dissertation, 1910) along with several other writings, mainly on ore geology, petrography, and mineralogy, in publications of the Swedish Geological Survey, the Geological Society of Stockholm, Economic Geology, and other publication series, as well as contributions to the Book of Inventions and the Sciences of Technology. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Knight First Class of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences, and of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences-Goteborg Branch.

GEIJER, Karl Herman Thorild, Director, Karlstad, b. Kristianstad 22/5 1903, son of Consul H.V.G. and Julie af Ekström, m. Ebba Wallberg. Graduate of a commercial school and Gothenburg Commercial Institute. Employed at Carl J. Svensson, Wupperfeld, Germany, 1922-1923, AB Vacuum Oil Co, Stockholm, 1930-1932, Herman Geijer & Co AB, Kristianstad, 1924-1930 and since 1932. Board Deputy of Wermland Wholesale Company, Board Member of the Swedish Wallboard Wholesale Company. Travels: Germany, Poland, Hungary, France, England, 1923-1939. Hobby: Stamp collection.

von GEIJER, Gottschalk Knut Bror Fredrik, Civil Engineer, Västerås, b. Allerum, Malmöhus County, 22/8 1900, son of Mayor K.E. von G. and Esther Henckel, m. Karin Tamm. Graduate of Stockholm 1920, Royal Institute of Technology, Electrical Engineering, 1922-1926. Employed at the Telegraph Administration 1927, the Patent and Registration Administration 1927-1929, the State Water Power Board, Älvkarleby Power Plant, Stockholm, 1929, currently district engineer at the same power plant in Västerås. Member of the Swedish Engineering Association.

af GEIJERSTAM, Erik Olof Emanuel, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, b. Rockhammar, Fellingsbro, Örebro County, 29/5 1905, son of Estate Owner C. af G. and Eivor Stanzén, m. Brita Sundin. Graduate of Fellingsbro 1923, Royal Institute of Technology (Electrical Engineering) 1925-1929. Reserve Officer Candidate 1925, Second Lieutenant in the Uppland Artillery Regiment reservists 1925, Lieutenant in the Norrland Artillery Regiment reservists 1928, Lieutenant from 1930. Employed at AB Max Sievert 1933-1934, Central Aircraft Workshop Västerås 1935-1936, AB Swedish Fan Factory Stockholm since 1936. Member of the Swedish Engineering Association.

af GEIJERSTAM, Olof Erik Wilhelm Emanuel, Civil Engineer, Hasslarp, b. Malmö 30/6 1911, son of Civil Engineer T.E. af G. and Eva Lindencrona. Graduate of Kristianstad 1929, Royal Institute of Technology (Chemistry) 1929-1933. Chemist at the Swedish Sugar Factory AB's sugar factory in Örtofta 1934-1936, Sugar Factory Staffanstorp 1936, currently operating engineer at Hasslarp's sugar refinery. Member of the Swedish Engineering Association.

structured.name: Per Adolf Geijer

award.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences
Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences-Goteborg Branch

publications: Igneous rocks and iron ores of Kiirunavaara, Luossavaara, and Tuollavaara (1910)
Various publications on ore geology, petrography, and mineralogy
